Package tiger.ui

Class Ui

  • java.lang.Object
    • tiger.ui.Ui
  • public class Ui
extends java.lang.Object
    Ui is responsible for handling interactions with users. This includes responding and listening to user commands, storing user tasks, and loading user tasks.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void exit()
      Exits the Ui.
      void runUntilStopped()
      Makes the Ui class listen to user inputs and respond to user commands until the user quits.
      static Ui start()
      Attempts to initalise the Ui class until successful.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public static Ui start()
        Attempts to initalise the Ui class until successful. If the storage file is corrupted, asks the user if the storage should be wiped or if a partial load should be done.
        Returns:
        a new Ui class that is properly initalised.

      • runUntilStopped

        public void runUntilStopped()
        Makes the Ui class listen to user inputs and respond to user commands until the user quits. Ask saves the TaskList for every command.

      • exit

        public void exit()
        Exits the Ui.
